text:
Hello.

Because of org.apache.catalina.util.ReqeustUtil#parseParameters, the single
direction converter (for example, JISAutoDetect) cannot be set to
ServletRequest#setCharacterEncoding (A parameter may be set to null).

Although the single direction converter is possible for the conversion to String
from byte[], conversion to byte[] from String cannot be performed.

Should I use not org.apache.ajp.tomcat4.Ajp13Connector but
org.apache.coyote.tomcat4.CoyoteConnector?

org.apache.coyote.tomcat4.CoyoteConnector Is mod_jk (not being mod_jk2) connectable?
Is org.apache.coyote.tomcat4.CoyoteConnector product quality?

Thanks.
creator: kazawa@rd.scei.sony.co.jp

text:
I am sorry but I don't really understand the problem you are describing. I 
think you are having character encoding problems but I am not sure.

Assuming that you are, there have been several updates to TC4 (and TC5) to 
improve i18n support. Please try the latest release. IF you continue to have 
problems I would suggest that the tomcat-user mailing list would be an 
appropriate forum to follow up any issues you have.

I am going to resolve this bug as invalid as I can't understand it. If you 
believe you have a valid bug with the latest version of TC4 please re-open 
this bug. A step by step guide to reproduce the problem (or better yet a 
simple jsp that demonstrates it) would be of great help.
creator: markt@apache.org
